page.title: 17DANES' HILL, DALWOOD.
page.content: Danes Hill is called Danes Hill because the Danes fought on it. People used it for lighting beacons to warn other villages of danger. There are about 14 houses on Danes Hill. There is one called Bagaton. It is very old and it used to be a pub. There are electricity pylons all around the hill. There is a badgers set and there are lots of rabbits. You also see lots of squirrels and a few foxes. A lot of people who live on Danes Hill are old people.Danes Hill is owned by Mr Pike but you are allowed to walk up it any time you want. From the top of Danes Hill to the west you can see Dalwood. On the other side of the hill is the valley of the River Yarty. Normally sheep graze on the hillside.
